verb.description: Cut (something) with a violent sweeping movement, typically using a knife or sword.
examples: a tire was slashed on my car
they cut and slashed their way to the river
the man slashed at him with a sword

noun.description: A cut made with a wide, sweeping stroke.
examples: the man took a mighty slash at his head with a large sword

noun.description: An oblique stroke (/) in print or writing, used between alternatives (e.g. and/or), in fractions (e.g. 3/4), in ratios (e.g. miles/day), or between separate elements of a text.
Debris resulting from the felling or destruction of trees.

conjunction.description: Used to link alternatives or words describing or denoting a dual (or multiple) function or nature.
examples: the most insane-slash-brilliant maneuver in the show's history
